terms.मनुष्यत्वं: (Manushyatvam) - the state or quality of being a human being
terms.मुमुक्षुत्वं: (Mumukshutvam) - the desire for liberation or freedom from worldly existence
terms.महापुरुषसम्भवः: (Mahapurushasambhavah) - the possibility of attaining greatness or becoming a great person

meaning: Meaning:This verse is from the Sanskrit scripture "Vivekachudamani" which is attributed to the great philosopher and saint Adi Shankaracharya.The verse emphasizes the potential of every human being. It states that the true purpose or essence of human life is to attain liberation or freedom from the cycle of birth and death. This desire for liberation is what distinguishes human beings from other creatures. Thus, being born as a human being is an opportunity to realize this highest goal of life.Overall, this verse reflects on the importance of recognizing the power, purpose, and potential that human life offers and the need for spiritual awakening to attain liberation and greatness.
